data.title: How Tom Jones rediscovered his real musical passion late in life
data.meta_description: Sir Tom Jones doesn't need our sympathy.
data.text:
Sir Tom Jones doesn't need our sympathy. He's spent the last half-century both rich and famous, more or less. But there is something noble about his staying the course, the way the Welsh singer, born Thomas Jones Woodward, followed his dream even if he was not always true to his art.

The title of his memoir, Over the Top and Back, refers to Jones' escape from the hollow glamour of his Vegas period to the return, late in his career, to the authentic, soulful music that always spoke to him, even when he wasn't listening. The book's publication is paired with the release of a new album, Long Lost Suitcase. Jones, now 75, brings his distinctive sound to blues, rockabilly and other American-roots-style numbers. Already, the recording has received an enthusiastic welcome by critics.
